title: The Masked Singer Australia: The identity of Dragon is revealed
text:
The identity of The Dragon on The Masked Singer Australia has been revealed.

On Tuesday night's episode, the mystery celebrity was unmasked as Australian country singer Adam Brand.

Three of the judges were way off, but Dannii Minogue correctly guessed the identity of the man behind the costume.

Did you guess it? The identity of The Dragon on The Masked Singer Australia has been revealed

Lindsay Lohan guessed Keith Urban, Jackie 'O' Henderson guessed Shannon Noll, and Dave Hughes thought it was Lee Kernaghan.

The Dragon's clues included that he was a 'western dragon', and that he was built for speed and possessed artistic balance.

In other clues, the Italian flag appeared on screen alongside footage of Dragon cooking in a kitchen.

There he is! On Tuesday night's episode, the mystery celebrity was unmasked as Australian country singer Adam Brand. Pictured with host Osher Günsberg (right)

How sweet! Adam said he hoped that one day, several years down the track, his daughter will proudly tell her friends, 'My daddy was the singing dragon'

Explaining the clues after he was unmasked, Adam said he is of Italian descent and was actually born Adamo Alberto Brun.

He added that the motorsport clues referenced his involvement in the Brute Utes with television star Grant Denyer.

Speaking to host Osher Günsberg on stage, Adam revealed that his daughter inspired him to participate in the show.

Correct! Dannii Minogue (pictured) correctly guessed that Adam was the man behind the mask

Clueless! Meanwhile, viewers flocked to Twitter to mock Lindsay Lohan's apparent confusion in the moments after Adam was unmasked. Pictured with Dave Hughes (right)

Adam said he hoped that one day, several years down the track, his daughter will proudly tell her friends, 'My daddy was the singing dragon.'

Meanwhile, viewers flocked to Twitter to mock Lindsay Lohan's apparent confusion in the moments after Adam was unmasked.

'I live for the constant confusion on Lindsay's face,' one person tweeted.

Another wrote, 'I feel like Lindsay right now,' referencing the American star's difficultly recognising local celebrities.

The Masked Singer continues Monday at 7.30pm on Channel 10
